alert.note: Alert for Eastern Chesterfield (Including Col. Heights); Eastern Hanover; Eastern Henrico; Western Chesterfield; Western Hanover; Western Henrico (Including the City of Richmond) (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 17 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Chesterfield, Henrico and southeastern Hanover Counties and the City of Richmond through 530 PM EDT... At 443 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Laurel to Tuckahoe to near Moseley. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Richmond, Downtown Richmond, Bon Air, Virginia Union University, Virginia Commonwealth University, Tuckahoe, University Of Richmond, Chester, Mechanicsville, Highland Springs, Bensley, Bellwood, East Highland Park, Glen Allen, Laurel, Studley, Lakeside, Chesterfield Court House, Chesterfield and Richmond Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
